org.obrel.core

Class RelationTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelationTypes

  • public class RelationTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a factory class to create relation types with different target data types and parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getRelationTypeNamespace

        public static java.lang.String getRelationTypeNamespace(java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Returns the relation type namespace for a certain class. This will either be the value of the annotation Annotations.RelationTypeNamespace or if that is not present, the name of the class itself, including it's own namespace.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to determine the relation type namespace of
        Returns:
        The relation type namespace

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • newDefaultValueType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newDefaultValueType(Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fDefaultValue,
                                                      RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type with a default value function. IMPORTANT: default values are returned if no relation with the type exists, but querying them will not create a new relation. That means that checks for relation existence will yield FALSE. To make sure a relation exists use newInitialValueType(Object, RelationTypeModifier...) instead.
        See Also:
        newRelationType(String, Class, Function, RelationTypeModifier...)

      • newListType

        public static <T> RelationType<java.util.List<T>> newListType(RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a partially initialized relation type with a List datatype that will have an instance of ArrayList as it's initial value.
        Parameters:
        rModifiers - The optional type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type for relations to lists

      • newListType

        public static <T> RelationType<java.util.List<T>> newListType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                              java.lang.Class<? super T> rElementType,
                                                              RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type with a List datatype. The initial value of relations with the returned type will be a new instance of ArrayList.

        The datatype of the list elements is stored as a relation with the meta relation type MetaTypes.ELEMENT_DATATYPE on the new type.

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the new type
        rElementType - The datatype of the list elements
        rModifiers - The optional type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type for list relations

      • newMapType

        public static <K,V> RelationType<java.util.Map<K,V>> newMapType(boolean bOrdered,
                                                                RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a partially initialized relation type with a Map datatype. Depending on the boolean parameter the initial value will either be an instance of LinkedHashMap or of HashMap.
        Parameters:
        bOrdered - TRUE for a map that preserves the order in which elements are added
        rModifiers - The optional type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type for relations to maps

      • newMapType

        public static <K,V> RelationType<java.util.Map<K,V>> newMapType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                java.lang.Class<? super K> rKeyType,
                                                                java.lang.Class<? super V> rValueType,
                                                                boolean bInitialValue,
                                                                boolean bOrdered,
                                                                RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type with a Map datatype. Depending on the value of the boolean argument the initial value of relations with the returned type will either be a new instance of HashMap (FALSE) or LinkedHashMap (TRUE).

        The datatype of the keys and values in the map are stored as meta relations on the returned relation type with the meta relation types MetaTypes.KEY_DATATYPE and MetaTypes.VALUE_DATATYPE.

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the new type
        rKeyType - The datatype of the map keys
        rValueType - The datatype of the map values
        bInitialValue - TRUE if the returned relation type has an initial value, FALSE to return NULL if no relation is set
        bOrdered - If bDefaultValue is TRUE, TRUE for a map that preserves the order in which elements are added
        rModifiers - The optional type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type for map relations

      • newObjectType

        public static RelationType<java.lang.Object> newObjectType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                           RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type with an object datatype. The initial value of relations with the returned type will be NULL.
        See Also:
        newRelationType(String, Class, Function, RelationTypeModifier...)

      • newObjectTypeType

        public static <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> RelationType<E> newObjectTypeType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                              java.lang.Class<E> rEnumType,
                                                                              RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type for an object type attribute with no default value. The datatype must be an enum class. To indicate that the type contains the type attribute of an object a marker relation of type MetaTypes.OBJECT_TYPE_ATTRIBUTE is set on the returned type.
        See Also:
        newEnumType(String, Class, RelationTypeModifier...)

      • newRelationType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newRelationType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                  java.lang.Class<? super T> rDatatype,
                                                  Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fInitialValue,
                                                  RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type instance with default and initial values of NULL.
        See Also:
        newRelationType(String, Class, Function, Function, RelationTypeModifier...)

      • newRelationType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newRelationType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                  java.lang.Class<? super T> rDatatype,
                                                  Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fDefaultValue,
                                                  Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fInitialValue,
                                                  RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type instance with a certain initial value. The initial values for relations with the new type will be created by evaluating the initial value function argument with the argument of the relation type method RelationType.initialValue(Relatable).

        For some standard datatypes this class contains more specific factory methods like newStringType(String, RelationTypeModifier...) which provide better readability for the creation of standard property types with typical default values.

        The generic types of the datatype parameter and of the return value of the initial value function have been relaxed to '? super T' so that this method can also be used for relation types that reference generic types. Without this widening generic types in the relation type declaration would not be valid when using the (base) class literal. On the other hand this means that it is possible to use a wrong type in the method call, thus creating a type that will probably cause runtime exceptions when used. Therefore this method should be used cautiously.

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the new relation type
        rDatatype - The datatype of relation targets with the type
        fDefaultValue - The default value function
        fInitialValue - The initial value function
        rModifiers - The optional relation type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type instance

      • newSetType

        public static <T> RelationType<java.util.Set<T>> newSetType(boolean bOrdered,
                                                            RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a partially initialized relation type with a Set datatype. Depending on the boolean parameter the initial value will either be an instance of LinkedHashSet or of HashSet.
        Parameters:
        bOrdered - TRUE for a set that preserves the order in which elements are added
        rModifiers - The optional type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type for relations to sets

      • newSetType

        public static <T> RelationType<java.util.Set<T>> newSetType(java.lang.String sName,
                                                            java.lang.Class<? super T> rElementType,
                                                            boolean bInitialValue,
                                                            boolean bOrdered,
                                                            RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new relation type with a Set datatype. The boolean parameters control whether the referenced set will be ordered (i.e. an instance of LinkedHashSet instead of HashSet) and if a default value (an empty set) will be created on first access.

        The datatype of the set elements is stored as a relation with the meta relation type MetaTypes.ELEMENT_DATATYPE on the new type.

        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the new type
        rElementType - The datatype of the set elements
        bInitialValue - TRUE if the returned relation type has an initial value, FALSE to return NULL if no relation is set
        bOrdered - TRUE for a set that preserves the order in which elements are added
        rModifiers - The optional type modifiers
        Returns:
        A new relation type for set relations

        public static RelationType<java.lang.String> newStringType(RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)

      • newType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newType(RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new partially initialized relation type that will only be valid after a call to init(Class) from the static initializer of the defining class.
        Parameters:
        rModifiers - The relation type modifiers
        Returns:
        The new uninitialized relation type

      • newType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newType(RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> rFlag,
                                          RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new partially initialized relation type that will only be valid after a call to init(Class) from the static initializer of the defining class.
        Parameters:
        rFlag - A flag annotation type to be set on the new type
        rModifiers - The relation type modifiers
        Returns:
        The new uninitialized relation type

      • newType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newType(Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fInitialValue,
                                          RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new partially initialized relation type that will only be valid after a call to init(Class) from the static initializer of the defining class.
        Parameters:
        fInitialValue - A function that returns the initial value for relations of this type
        rModifiers - The relation type modifiers
        Returns:
        The new uninitialized relation type

      • newType

        public static <T> RelationType<T> newType(Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fDefaultValue,
                                          Function<? super Relatable,? super T> fInitialValue,
                                          RelationTypeModifier... rModifiers)
        Creates a new partially initialized relation type that will only be valid after a call to init(Class) from the static initializer of the defining class.
        Parameters:
        fDefaultValue - The default value
        fInitialValue - A function that returns the initial value for relations of this type
        rModifiers - The relation type modifiers
        Returns:
        The new uninitialized relation type
